metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5073 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the find_fixedlength function in pcre_compile.c in PCRE before 8.38 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or obtain sensitive information from heap memory and possibly bypass the ASLR protection mechanism via a crafted regular expression with an excess closing parenthesis.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5073` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> in wily, this was already fixed by the fix_find_fixedlength patch, but the testcases weren't included  was supposed to be fixed in wily (2:8.35-7ubuntu2) but got reverted in (2:8.35-7ubuntu5) by mistake  CVE-2015-2325_CVE-2015-2326_CVE-2015-3210_CVE-2015-5073.patch in jessie

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1').
